meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your boy, back with another review that's sure to make you laugh, cry (just kidding, I'm not that mean), and maybe even give you a few pointers on how to conquer those pesky Germans in Men of War II.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "What's the deal with these scores, anyway?" Well, let me tell you. I've got a special trick up my sleeve. Instead of telling you all about the scores (boring!), we're gonna dive right into the gameplay, and then maybe, just maybe, we'll get around to talking about those numbers.

So, what's Men of War II? It's a real-time strategy game that's all about World War II - think Command & Conquer, but with more... war. And I'm not saying that in a bad way! The gameplay is deep, folks. Like, really deep. You can build units, research techs, and execute complex strategies to take down your enemies. It's like playing chess, but with tanks and planes instead of pieces.

But here's the thing - it's not all sunshine and rainbows. See, Men of War II has a bit of a learning curve. Like, a big one. You'll need to invest some serious time into understanding its systems and mechanics if you want to succeed. And that's where those scores come in. Apparently, folks are divided on whether it's worth the effort.

SpazioGames thinks it's a game-changer (77 out of 100), while COGconnected says it's more approachable than it seems (78 out of 100). PC Gamer just calls it "a flawed but rewarding gem" (74 out of 100). Cubed3, on the other hand, is a bit more critical, giving it a score of 60 and saying it's solid but marred by clunky controls. GameSpew gives it a 70, praising its realism and freedom to explore strategies. IGN Italia loves it, giving it an 80 for its depth and unique experience. And CGMagazine? Yeah, they're not too impressed, giving it a paltry 65.

So, what's the verdict? Well, that's up to you, folks! If you're looking for a challenging RTS with a ton of replay value, Men of War II might be just what you need. Just don't say I didn't warn you - it's not for the faint of heart!

That's it for now. Hippo Penny out!
